file_content.text: Activation protocol begins. So, after the long silence, finally someone comes.
I am Garon Jard. Millennia ago, I stood as a founder of the Jedi Order.
For a hologram, you're surprisingly articulate.
You seem almost alive.
We needed worthy vessels for our knowledge.
There are Flesh Raiders in the area. Your holoprojector's at risk, I'm here to save it.
I was sent to save you.
To protect without fighting. A trait I wanted at the core of our beliefs.
You may be programmed to think you're Garon Jard, but this is just an image.
You're still just a hologram.
Maybe so. But my wisdom can still be useful--to those who'll listen.
When the Jedi Order began, I saw we must be dedicated to peace. To calming our emotions, and ending war across the galaxy.
If we fought, it should only be in self-defense. That is the founding principle of civilization.
Being civilized also means defending those weaker than yourself.
What about protecting others?
Indeed. But we must do so knowing the mark it will leave, upon history and on ourselves.
Without peace, there could be no art or culture, or politics. No Republic.
I agree.
When a civilization is under attack, its technology and culture develop faster than they do in peacetime.
We need war to bring progress.
Deadlier weapons. Stronger armies. Do they feed the hungry, or heal the sick?
The Jedi may have changed, but galactic peace has always remained one of our goals.
Activation protocol complete. Go well.
